title: 107_hr1927
content: The Act titled "Solid Waste International Transportation Act of 2001" amends the Solid Waste Disposal Act to include a new section on the receipt and disposal of foreign municipal solid waste. The Act allows states to regulate foreign municipal solid waste receipt and disposal without unduly burdening interstate or foreign commerce. Definitions include foreign municipal solid waste as waste generated outside the US and municipal solid waste as all discarded waste materials. The Act allows states to regulate foreign municipal solid waste receipt and disposal without unduly burdening interstate or foreign commerce. Definitions include all waste materials discarded for disposal by households, commercial, institutional, municipal, and industrial sources. The Act allows states to regulate municipal solid waste collection services, excluding hazardous materials regulated under subtitle C. Examples of municipal solid waste include food waste, paper, clothing, appliances, and household hazardous waste. Debris from construction, remodeling, repair, or demolition is not considered municipal solid waste. This exclusion applies to hazardous waste, contaminated soil, and debris from environmental response actions. The curr_chunk discusses various types of materials that are exempt from being classified as solid waste, including recyclable materials separated from waste, scrap rubber for fuel, and materials returned to manufacturers. The curr_chunk defines solid waste generated by an industrial facility and transported for treatment, storage, or disposal to a facility owned by the generator or an affiliated company. The curr_chunk specifies various types of waste that can be disposed of in a facility owned by the generator or an affiliated company, including medical waste, sewage sludge, combustion ash, and waste from manufacturing or processing operations. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include a new item in the table of contents related to waste disposal operations. The Solid Waste Disposal Act is amended to include a new item related to the receipt and disposal of foreign municipal solid waste.
